"Peter Marks" <peter.c.marks@...> writes:

> A couple of things came to mind as I read your message:
>
> 1. There is a SourceForge project call JOSSO (Java Open Single Sign On
> project - http://www.josso.org ) that, at least superficially, may satisfy
> your requirements. And it seems possible that it could be or could become
> RESTful.
>
> 2. The Liberty Alliance project. Looking at its Profiles spec (
> http://www.projectliberty.org/specs/draft-liberty-idff-bindings-profiles-1.2-errata-v2.0.pdf
> ) and its descriptions of its GET, POST, etc. usage, it, too, might be be
> RESTful. I wonder if anyone has looked at the Liberty Profiles from the POV
> of REST?

I posted on this before. I wrote a RESTfull adaptation of the liberty
(OASIS) protocols for SSO for Thomson plc.

The liberty stuff itself wasn't RESTfull when I looked at it. But my
stuff was RESTfull without breaking it.


Nic
